alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 1:40PM PST until December 28 at 3:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...Heavy snow at times in the mountains tonight, especially in San Bernardino County and Riverside County... ...Another winter storm to bring heavy snow to the mountains late Monday and Monday night... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total accumulations of 2 to 5 inches are expected above 5500 feet late tonight and early Sunday. Additional accumulations of 4 to 8 inches are possible late Monday and Monday night, with snow levels falling to around 3500 feet. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, 10 PM today to 10 AM Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 2 PM Monday afternoon through 3 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant reductions in visibility are likely in snow and fog. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
